context: The parameters K s and v max were estimated from such profiles by curve fitting using Eq. (10). Monod kinetic parameters for toluene, m-xylene, n-octane, and n-hexane could be obtained this way and compiled with literature data (Table 3) . For the other compounds, the flux was constant indicating no degradation activity (CFC-113, MTBE, and n-pentane), or flux versus concentration profiles were linear indicating first-order kinetics over the entire range of concentrations (cyclic alkanes, isooctane, and 1,2,4-trimethylbenzene), or they had too few data points to be interpreted (n-decane). Monod parameters could not be obtained in any of these cases.Batch experiments In control experiments using bottles without sand, gaseous concentrations of all VOCs except n-dodecane (data not shown) stayed within ±10% of the initial concentrations for 15 days (Fig. 6) . In abiotic controls, concentrations of all VOCs decreased between 0.5 and 5.5 h after VOC injection following first-order rate law (Fig. 6) with rate constants ranging between 0.13±0.13 day−1 for methylcyclohexane and 0.91±0.52
